victim.name: Blaise Vance
victim.occupation: The station's expert engineer, Blaise maintained the intricate systems that kept the sprawling mining habitat operational, often delving into the most dangerous sectors to repair critical infrastructure.
victim.personality: Immensely loyal to the crew, Blaise was the kind of person others could depend on during crises, though his reserved nature meant he shared little about his own past or thoughts.
victim.cause_of_death: Crushed beneath a rogue mining scaffold, the fatal incident was initially deemed an accident until further investigation suggested deliberate environmental sabotage.

profile.name: Cleo Mercer
profile.description: Cleo, a seasoned pilot with a reputation for unwavering precision, always carried an air of quiet authority within the cramped cockpit of the mining station. Her loyalty to the crew was apparent, yet she harbored a subtle, critical eye on the station’s operations and personnel.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Station pilot who often coordinated with Blaise during high-risk repair missions.

original_mmo.means: Cleo could have remotely manipulated the mining scaffold controls during a scheduled repair mission, causing it to detach and fall on Blaise while he was working in a vulnerable position.
original_mmo.motive: Although outwardly loyal, Cleo resented Blaise's reserved nature and suspected he knowingly withheld information that endangered the crew; furthermore, she stood to gain a significant inheritance linked to the station if Blaise was out of the picture.
original_mmo.opportunity: As the station pilot responsible for coordinating high-risk repairs, Cleo had access to the control systems and was present in the control room overseeing scaffold movements during Blaise's fatal repair session.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: As the station pilot responsible for coordinating high-risk repairs, Cleo had access to the control systems and was present in the control room overseeing scaffold movements during Blaise's fatal repair session.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Although Cleo usually coordinated repairs, on the day of Blaise's accident she was grounded due to a mandatory rest period and was confined to her quarters, with station logs confirming she neither accessed nor was present in the control room during the scaffold operation.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: The station logs and enforced rest period provide Cleo with a solid alibi, removing her opportunity to manipulate the scaffold controls at the crucial time.

profile.name: Drake Starling
profile.description: Drake worked behind the station’s bustling mess hall counter, known for his genial nature and steady hands serving weary miners. Despite his outward warmth, those who looked closer noted his mysterious past and the private dealings he kept carefully hidden.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Bartender on the station who overheard confidences from Blaise and other crew members.

original_mmo.means: Drake had access to the tools and maintenance schedules through casual conversations with Blaise and others, allowing him to tamper with the scaffold's support mechanisms, causing it to fail remotely at a crucial moment.
original_mmo.motive: Drake attempted to blackmail Blaise after overhearing sensitive information during their interactions; when Blaise refused to comply, Drake resorted to sabotage to eliminate the threat and cover his tracks.
original_mmo.opportunity: Working long shifts behind the mess hall adjacent to the engineering sectors, Drake had ample occasion during late-night hours when the station was less monitored to execute the sabotage without being seen.

profile.name: Zion Vance
profile.description: Zion, a fellow engineer and distant relative of Blaise, was known for his steadfast commitment to the station’s safety systems and a deeply trustworthy demeanor. His reserved manner masked a growing obsession with Blaise’s success and position aboard the habitat.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Cousin and fellow engineer with professional rivalry.

original_mmo.means: Zion secretly tampered with the anchoring mechanisms of a mining scaffold in a remote sector, weakening its stability to cause it to collapse when Blaise was performing maintenance.
original_mmo.motive: Consumed by jealousy over Blaise's reputation and success, Zion's obsession drove him to eliminate his cousin to claim Blaise's position and recognition on the station.
original_mmo.opportunity: Zion had access to the dangerous mining sectors through his engineering duties and was able to sabotage the scaffold during a shift change when supervision was lax.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: Zion secretly tampered with the anchoring mechanisms of a mining scaffold in a remote sector, weakening its stability to cause it to collapse when Blaise was performing maintenance.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Though suspected of tampering, detailed forensic analysis of the scaffold's anchoring mechanisms revealed tampering occurred well after the collapse, indicating Zion could not have weakened the scaffold beforehand.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: The forensic timing evidence disproves Zion's ability to sabotage the scaffold before the accident, removing his means.

evidence_items.description: A series of encrypted text messages on Cleo's communication device reveal a heated exchange from the day before Blaise's accident: 'You don't have to protect him anymore. The crew deserves the truth,' and her reply, 'Soon. Just have to wait for the right moment.'
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This communication implies Cleo harbored grievances against Blaise and contemplated exposing him, suggesting a motive rooted in resentment and distrust.
evidence_items.evidence_category: Digital Footprint (Browser History, Social Media Post, Text Message Log)
evidence_items.narrative_function_description: This piece of digital evidence casts suspicion on Cleo by highlighting her discord with Blaise and her possible intent to undermine him, thereby establishing a motive as a red herring.

evidence_items.description: A marked-up blueprint fragment of the mining scaffold controls with notes in Cleo's handwriting, highlighting potential vulnerabilities and proposed modifications to safety protocols.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The marked blueprint demonstrates Cleo’s technical knowledge and potential capability to manipulate scaffold controls, suggesting she had the means to cause the accident.
evidence_items.narrative_function_description: This blueprint serves to suggest Cleo’s technical means to interfere with the scaffold system, reinforcing suspicion through her expertise, yet it is a red herring as she did not act on these in the incident.

evidence_items.description: An official medical record indicating Cleo was subjected to a mandatory rest period on the day of Blaise's accident, with strict orders to remain confined to her quarters and avoid control room access.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This record confirms Cleo lacked the opportunity to manipulate the scaffold controls during the critical time, supporting her alibi and weakening the case against her.
evidence_items.narrative_function_description: This official document is a crucial piece of exculpatory evidence that disproves Cleo’s opportunity, providing a solid alibi and neutralizing suspicion about her involvement.

evidence_items.description: Access logs extracted from the station's maintenance terminal show Drake Starling remotely issuing an unauthorized override command to the scaffold's support system just minutes before its catastrophic failure, timestamped during his usual late-night shift hours.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This digital record directly links Drake to the tampering of critical structural systems, confirming his capability to cause the fatal accident.
evidence_items.evidence_category: Digital Footprint (Browser History, Social Media Post, Text Message Log)
evidence_items.narrative_function_description: This concrete digital footprint evidences Drake's technical means to sabotage the scaffold, removing doubt about who executed the remote override.

evidence_items.description: An official internal incident report notes that during an interview, conflicting statements from Drake Starling suggested prior knowledge of infrastructure vulnerabilities, which he initially denied despite later evidence proving otherwise.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The report hints at Drake's hidden agenda to withhold information and implies a motive rooted in manipulation and silence.
evidence_items.narrative_function_description: This official document highlights inconsistencies that reveal Drake’s strong motive to silence Blaise to cover his own misconduct, reinforcing his guilt.

evidence_items.description: A folded, annotated blueprint fragment of the station’s scaffold support system was found in Drake’s locker, featuring added notes in his handwriting pointing to a critical weak point bypassing standard safety protocols.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The blueprint fragment confirms Drake’s intimate knowledge of the exact location and method to exploit the scaffold’s vulnerability during his late-night shifts.
evidence_items.narrative_function_description: This personal possession shows Drake premeditated the sabotage by marking structural weaknesses, establishing his opportunity to strike undetected.

evidence_items.description: Log entries from the station's security feed show Zion accessing the terminal near the scaffold sector during the shift change, moments before the scaffold failure but no direct commands to the anchoring system were issued from his credentials.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This security log highlights Zion's physical presence near the scene during a vulnerable time, implying he had the opportunity to tamper with the scaffold.
evidence_items.evidence_category: Digital Footprint (Browser History, Social Media Post, Text Message Log)
evidence_items.narrative_function_description: The log suggests Zion was nearby at a critical time, serving as suspicious evidence implying opportunity, misleadingly increasing suspicion despite means being disproven.

evidence_items.description: Blueprint fragment of the remote mining scaffold's anchoring system found in Zion's personal locker, annotated with notes highlighting structural weaknesses and potential failure points, dated weeks before the incident.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The annotated blueprint indicates Zion's detailed knowledge and possible intent to exploit vulnerabilities in the scaffold, aligning with a motive fueled by jealousy of Blaise's role.
evidence_items.narrative_function_description: This blueprint piece points toward Zion's possible plans to sabotage the scaffold, reinforcing the motive, yet it does not confirm any actual sabotage beforehand, thus acting as a misleading clue.
